Class Piece

java.lang.Object
Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Cat, Dog, Elephant, Leopard, Lion, Mouse, Tiger, Wolf
public abstract class Piece extends Object
The abstract class Piece represents a Piece.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ysabel Bondoc, Jaime Manalo

      public Piece​(boolean red, String n, int rk, int r, int c)
      This constructor sets the piece's basic attributes
      Parameters:
      red - The color of the piece
      n - the name of the piece
      rk - the rank of the piece
      r - the row coordinate of the piece
      c - the column coordinate of the piece

    • canMovePiece

      public boolean canMovePiece​(int r, int c, Piece p)
      This method checks if the piece can move to the location where another piece is currently located
      Parameters:
      r - the row coordinate the piece is moving to
      c - the column coordinate the piece is moving to
      p - the piece that is on the coordinate this piece is moving to
      Returns:
      whether the piece can move and capture the piece on the coordinate it is moving to

    • returnRank

      public abstract void returnRank()
      This abstract method returns the rank of the piece to it's original rank

    • canMove

      public abstract boolean canMove​(int r, int c)
      This abstract method checks where the piece can move when there is no other piece on their destination
      Parameters:
      r - the row coordinate the piece is moving to
      c - the column coordinate the piece is moving to
      Returns:
      whether the piece can move to this tile or not

    • riverJump

      public abstract boolean riverJump​(int r, int c)
      This abstract method checks whether the piece can jump through an empty river
      Parameters:
      r - the row coordinate the piece is moving to
      c - the column coordinate the piece is moving to
      Returns:
      whether the piece can jump the river

    • riverJumpMouse

      public abstract boolean riverJumpMouse​(int r, int c, Piece p)
      This abstract method checks whether the piece can jump through the river if there is a piece on the river
      Parameters:
      r - the row coordinate the piece is moving to
      c - the column coordinate the piece is moving to
      p - the piece that is on the river
      Returns:
      whether the piece can jump through the river
